headline: McCormick® Gingerbread Men Cookies
description: These Gingerbread Men Cookies are as cute as can be. If desired, decorate with raisins, currants or cinnamon red hot candies for eyes and buttons.
name: McCormick® Gingerbread Men Cookies

recipeInstructions.text: Mix flour, ginger, cinnamon, baking soda, nutmeg and salt in large bowl. Beat butter and brown sugar in another large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed until light and fluffy. Add molasses, egg and vanilla; beat well. Gradually beat in flour mixture on low speed until well mixed. Press dough into a thick flat disk. Wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate 4 hours or overnight.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Roll out dough to 1/4-inch thickness on lightly floured work surface. Cut into gingerbread men shapes with 5-inch cookie cutter. Place 1 inch apart on ungreased baking sheets.

Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until edges of cookies are set and just begin to brown. Cool on baking sheets 1 to 2 minutes. Remove to wire racks; cool completely. Decorate cooled cookies as desired. Store cookies in airtight container up to 5 days.

review.reviewBody:
This was a winner! The directions were easy to follow, and the cookies turned out great! Crisp but not hard. 
I left the dough in the refrigerator for 3 days, until i had time to bake, and it didn’t affect the outcome at all.
I exchanged the flour for King Arthur's GF one to one flour. They still kept their shape and texture perfect for decorating. And they taste great! Using this one again next year!
I made the cookies as the recipe suggested and they are amazing.
This gingerbread cookie was a unanimous hit. I've added the recipe to my holiday cookie list.

Easy to make and follow directions. I’m not a huge gingerbread cookie person, but my girls really wanted to make them after my oldest read the gingerbread man story. I had everything in the cupboard so figured why not. They loved it.

This was my first time making gingerbread so I'm not sure how this recipe compares to others, but overall I thought the cookies turned out pretty good! I followed the recipe as is except for not using McCormick brand for all the spices and adding a little extra ginger. I chilled the dough in the fridge overnight and it was very difficult to work with. It was super sticky and I had to constantly add flour to my board and the dough, I was worried with all the extra flour I was adding they wouldn't turn out right! I baked them for 10 minutes and they came out really well, nice and soft but not too soft. They taste great, could be just a little sweeter though so I may add a bit more cinnamon and brown sugar next time.

Wonderful recipe! Everyone loves them. The only tip I can give is use a generous amount of flour when rolling out. The recipe said roll out on a “lightly floured” surface, but my dough stuck badly and I had to scrape it up and try again, twice. Maybe my dough was extra sticky, but I had to use a lot of flour before I could get them up without ruining them.

Easy peasy! Whipped up this recipe and made some delish ninja-bread cookies to decorate with the kiddos. Great spice flavor, I went under by 1min and this left them soft inside but firm outside. Was a little sticky when rolling it out but a little flour did the trick. Will definitely try again
They came out awesome! Thanks
I was sad that I lost the gingerbread recipe that I had been making for years. I found this one online and it's even better than the other one. Soft and delicious.

Not only are these delicious (buttery and not super spicy), they are absolutely adorable! We didn't have a gingerbread man cookie cutter, so we made gingerbread bears. ;) We only refrigerated the dough for two hours and it was still easy to work with. This was our first time making gingerbread and I am so pleased at how easy it was!
super good just i suggest adding a bit more sugar but other wise amazing recipe
Delicious with a zingy taste of excellence
Recipe was easy, taste was good. Cookies did not hold the cookie cutter shape when baking. They expanded and lost thickness.
I made these with my granddaughters so much fun and so easy
AMAZING!!!
This is an amazing recipe and I highly recommend supper easy not a lot of mess and very fun to decorate!!!
This recipe is perfect! Soft and slightly chewy cookies with perfect spice. This will be my go to recipe from now on!
Easy to make - was expecting it to be really sweet but turned out ok.

Good recipe but made some modifications. I like a spicy gingerbread cookie, so I tripled the spices, added some fresh grated ginger root, and upped the molasses to 3/4 cup. They turned out great!!!! And my house smells incredible too.

They weren’t bad, but they were pretty bland in my opinion. If I were to make these again, I’d probably up the spices by about 50%. Other than that, the dough was nice and easy to work with, and they baked well.
This was the perfect gingerbread recepie. Simple, easy, delicious and the cookies held their shape so well!

I love this recipe and have been given comments that it is the best Gingerbread cookies they have ever had! It is not overly spiced; just enough. If you prefer your Gingerbread more spiced; add a touch more. The dough is easy to work with too.
These cookies were delicious!! I did add a tsp. of All Spice just for a little extra holiday flavor and it was a perfect addition Definitely our new go to gingerbread men recipe!
Loved it! I suggest, no matter what you think (or smell) while mixing, just keep going!
Delicious
i will not make this again
Tasty and easy to work with!
Made this with my grandsons. Turned out perfectly and yummy. Will be my go to recipe !
They were a hit! My family loved them, and so much fun to make!
will definitely make again..
Made exactly as written. Didn’t ice them. My son (3) and I had a great time. Making these for Christmas! (Just plan an activity for the time it needs to chill. 3 year olds aren’t good at waiting!)

I never knew I loved gingerbread cookies until this recipe. I’d recommend rolling them out pretty thin because they kinda puff up and out. Nice spice level and they taste great on their own, unfrosted.

This is such a fun recipe. I always love making things like gingerbread men during Christmas time. It has a homey feeling to it. This recipe is kid friendly and super easy. I recommend icing these as well. They have a nice flavor and they're fun for everyone.
Used fresh ginger instead of powdered ginger. Could be a bit spicier, but great texture and flavor.
Really easy to make and turned out great :)
Delicious. I only had cloves in the house so I subbed that for nutmeg. The kids and I loved it!
Used splenda instead of sugar and used 1 cup whole wheat flour and 2 cups all purpose flour. They kept their shape very well and were tasty.

Overall a pretty great, trustworthy recipe. I didn't have time to let the dough chill in the fridge so I put it in the freezer for a short time and that seemed to work out great-the dough wasn't too hard to work with. I found 8 minutes were more than enough for the cook time and would recommend taking them out promptly. The reason I didn't give 5 stars is because in my opinion the cookies were really lacking flavor- and that's after I put in an extra tsp each of ginger, cinnamon and vanilla! I highly recommend using 4 tsp ginger and at least 2-3 tsp cinnamon if you love flavorful cookies. However I would definitely use this recipe again with the added spices.

I followed the recipe exactly, and as others have said, the dough was just too sticky, even after chilling as directed. The only way that I was able to salvage the dough and get it firm enough to cut out shapes was to knead another half cup or so of flour into it. I am giving 2 stars only because the flavor was ok (but just ok). Needs more spices for sure.

wWarning! The way the directions are written it's not very clear right away that it's a SEPERATE bowl that the flour in the first list of ingredients should be in and if you don't do that it goofs up the whole recipe. I made them in a previous year and they were good. I'm not sure how this is going to turn out.
Tastes like nothing but molasses, couldn’t taste the ginger at all. The nice chewy consistency is the only positive thing about this recipe.
This recipe was a hit followed the directions to a tea and they came out perfect! Highly recommend!

These were delicious! It helped to make sure that the dough wasn't too hard before rolling it out but once I learned that and once I floured my surface sufficiently, they came out just perfect! I used a smaller cookie cutter for a second batch and should have taken them out at 8 minutes but 10 minutes (in a gas stove) was perfect for a bit larger cookie. They do expand a bit in the oven so make sure not to overcrowd.
The cookies were easy to prepare, and they have a nice soft center when I baked them for 8 minutes.
dough is sticky to work with . troublesome transfer to baking sheet . delicious.
Turned out great after baking for 8 minutes in my oven.

I tasted one when it came out of the oven. I thought the next batch I would add more ginger. My daughter arrived home a couple of hours later and grabbed one on her way in (I store them in the cold garage). She said they were awesome, just right the way I had baked them. So I took a bite and realized the flavour had intensified over that time. In the end, the recipes stands as is. Will definitely be adding this cookie to my Christmas cookie list.

Six or seven stars if I could. THE BEST GINGERBREAD COOKIES EVER!!!!!!!!! This is a prize winner, I think. They came out of the oven golden brown, it is perfect. Everything is perfect, I think. This is probably the best cookie I ever made. We have never made gingerbread cookies before. It is also relatively easy to make. This is probably our best first-time-made-cookie SUCCESS!!!! Unbelievably good, so I highly suggest it.
They were pretty good. They came out soft and were firm enough to decorate however the taste wasn't as spicy as I'm used to. Definitely needs more spices.
Followed recipe exactly for some soft and tasty gingerbread cookies. I have a convection oven, so I lowered temperature to 335 degrees and baked for 8 to 8.5 minutes.

Just made these. So easy. The dough was great and very easy to work with. I added more spices, but I always do to every gingerbread. I’d make them a little thicker, but I prefer my gingerbread a little softer. 
Will definitely make again.
Made these for a fun holiday treat, delicious!

As I always do when I make spice cookies or cakes, I added quite a bit more than the recipe calls for, and 1/2 tablespoon orange zest. Other than that, I followed the recipe as written. Refrigerated overnight. It is not a normal cut-out cookie dough - it gets soft very quickly, so it is difficult to work with. I followed another reviewers suggestion of rolling and cutting directly onto the parchment and just sliding the parchment onto a chilled tray. I got 23 5” gingerbread boys, rolled to about 1/8” thick. Baked for 11 minutes gets a perfect cookie with not a lot of crunch, but still gives a good break! Even though you are re-working the dough several times, they cookies still turn out just the same - The orange zest makes this an out of this world flavor!
I made these with 1-1 gluten free flour. They were perfect! I wanted them a little chewy, and that’s exactly how they turned out!
I made them exactly as the recipe states. They are pretty delicious and my son loves them. Next time though I would like to try some fresh ginger. I like my cookies a little spicier.

For whatever reason this recipe is extremely sticky during the rolling and cutting phase. I tried using it chilled and I tried using flour. And sticks to my hands, the rolling pin, and to the parchment paper. Do not recommend this recipe.

Very yummy cookies. Just make sure not to overbake them otherwise they’ll be too dark and burned on the bottom, like mine. The cookies themselves taste good, especially with icing. I’ll definitely be making these again.
Loved this cookie, will be making them again!
It turned out great they are soft and chewy and everyone loved it

My 3 Grandsons did enjoy these but I did cut them a bit thicker than recipe called for since they enjoy a softer style cookie. I refrigerated my dough overnight (what a mistake) as it made it tough to roll out the next day. Bake times I found are depending on if you like a softer cookie (take out sooner) or crisp which leave it in longer. Not overpowering on the spices, just enough that you do notice it.
Awesome recipe! Cut them thick for soft cookies. I added buttercream frosting on top after they cooled...Divine!
The only thing I changed was the butter, I used UN salted bagel, as I can not have dairy, worked out great!
Two people who don’t normally like gingerbread cookies said they loved these. The dough was difficult to work with but I’m a beginner so it may have just been me...
The dough came out too sticky, I had to had tons of flour to it as it would not roll out. I even left it for a day in the fridge. I need to give it another try to be sure I did it right.

I lived this recipe! I will definitely make it again next time! Just make sure to rub the surface, dough, and rolling pin in flour to reduce stickiness. Definitely recommend for Christmas cookie decorating!!!
Yummy classic gingerbread recipe
smell great, totally fabulous. they taste good.
Turned out great! Just used powdered sugar instead of the frosting! Very yummy!
Perfect recipe tbh. Only thing I changed was the butter. I made browned butter and it turned out amazing. Will make again, even after the holidays.

Very strong molasses smell Even after 5 plus hours in the fridge the dough was very sticky. I ended up throwing away about half the dough and putting the rest back in the fridge. I followed this recipe to the T! So sad it didn’t turn out right
Absolutely delicious! These are soft, chewy, the perfect gingerbread cookies.

**We prefer a spicy cookie, so I added 1/2 tsp ground cloves, increased ginger to 2 1/2 tsp, increased cinnamon to 1 1/2 tsp, and increased nutmeg to 1/2 tsp. With the additions, this is a very tasty cookie! When I made them before, I found the flavor to be a bit bland (as others had stated). We also prefer a crispy cookie, so we baked for 10 minutes (rolled out to 1/4"). My 8-year old took over the rolling, cutting, and baking, so it is not a complex dough to work with.

I don’t know what made these cookies so wonderful but we can’t stop talking about how soft and delicious they are. I’ve never made gingerbread cookies before and my husband is now saying, you know you don’t have to wait for Christmas to make these”.
I followed option one in making balls and topping with Hershey kisses. Easy and everyone loved them. Thank you.
excellent - I will make again

This dough is way too wet to roll out or use cookies cutters with. I left it in the refrigerator for two nights, and it still was not hardened. I scraped it off of the plastic wrap and my hands... I must have added at least another half cup of flour before giving up and making them into drop cookies. The taste was good but they're gingerbread men without the men.

Perfect gingerbread people!
Using suggestions from others, I modified the recipe and used 1 teaspoon cinnamon; 2 teaspoons ginger; 1 teaspoon baking soda; 1/2 teaspoon ground cloves and 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg.
Roll the dough right on the parchment paper that you'll use to bake the cookies. Position your cookie cutter so you leave 1" space between each cookie. Lift off the excess dough around the cut-outs and place the cookies on the parchment paper on the tray and directly in the oven. Cookies wont be bent or out of shape using this method. After cooking if the shapes touch just use the edge of your spatula or knife to push through the area and separate gently.
Excellent!!

Fantastic recipe! Once again due to daughter’s celiac and my sensitivity to it, cut out flour altogether. I replaced 1/2 flour with almond flour and the other half with Bob’s Mill gluten-free all purpose flour. Wasn’t certain if the almond flour would ‘interfere’ with the ginger-ness of the cookie, so put 1/4 t more. They came out superbly. A tad of a crunch around the edge and nice and soft within.! Time to make another double batch!
This was my 2nd Christmas using this recipe. It is a major success! My husband’s coworkers request these cookies year round. It smells really bad when first mix, but tastes amazing next day

Simple recipe for gingerbread cookies... not too sweet and a good balance of spices. Be sure to roll dough out on a pastry mat with a little extra flour to keep it from sticking. I use a gas oven and found 8 minutes left my 1/4-inch thick, gingerbread man not fully cooked throughout, whereas 10 minutes was just right.
Made with Gluten free flour and they came out tasty.
I don’t typically like gingerbread cookies but OHEMGEEEE this recipe was great! Followed recipe to an”T” and wouldn’t change a thing.

Half way through the baking I would change the trays on the racks - bottom to top and turn the trays around to even out the baking. They only need 8 minutes in my oven. I overbaked the 1st batch by only a minute & what a difference. Can’t wait to decorate. I have small grandchildren so am using meringue powder instead of raw egg white for the royal icing. Will definitely make again next year.

Made it exactly as written. As much as I would love to give it a 1 star I can't because we will eat the gingerbread man. The dough is flaky and crumbly it doesn't hold together at all. It just falls apart. I made so much extra so I will definitely have to make changes. I 100% will NEVER make this recipe again. The taste is bland. It's ok but it really lacks flavour. Needs sugar or something. Something is missing in the cookies. I'm disappointed. But hey I tried and time to find a new recipe.
I doubt anybody giving 5 stars actually made this or followed the directions.
Grandson gave the recipe a thumbs up.
Perfect
First time trying this, wonderful, was a big hit. Thank you

This was my first time making gingerbread men cookies; I don't usually bake. I checked out a few different recipes before finding this one, which had less ingredients than a few others I found. I found this recipe simple to do, and they turned out great. They tasted pretty amazing too. I managed to yeild 2 large, 8 medium,12 small gingerbread men ( I had a 3 size pk of gingerbread men cookie cutters) I baked them a little longer get than suggested, so the little ones came out crispier than I would have liked. the bigger ones were great tho. Going to make them again to decorate with my neices\nefew, think I will stick to the 8-10 minutes the recipes says. Overall great. Thanks for the recipe
I used less molasses,1/4 cup instead of 1/2.
I love this recipe. The cookies baked beautifully & had a nice ginger-y taste. Will definitely make again for Christmas next year.

Made a double recipe all at once, wont make that mistake again! Too hard to mix with our hand mixer and almost too much dough for our largest bowl. Cookies turned out great, but the dough almost needs to be room temperature before the cookies are easy to cut and transfer to the sheets for baking. Remember if your icing with premodern stuff to get the kind that will harden.

I didn’t finish my review as I hit “done” before I was. In addition to increasing the spice, I would make the final dough into 2 or 3 balls and put in the fridge overnight. By the time I got close to finished, the dough was super soft. I rolled mine out on parchment paper and used a little gingerbread cookie cutter and got 50 cookies. My first back with the one large ball as per the instructions, were thicker so I ended up with less. I think if I had rolled these out to 1/4”, I would have ended up with even more. Unless you want extra crispy cookies, 9 minutes was best for a crunchy bottom and soft rest.
Perfect flavor and softer texture!

Could be just me, but the dough was very difficult to work with even after refrigerating, so I rolled the cookies into balls instead. Good flavor and smelled wonderful out of the oven but spices were underwhelming. Will try doubling the spices next time.
“Best cookies I’ve ever made” according to my 87 yr old Dad! I iced them with a buttercream “dip” by microwaving icing 20 sec
I made these cookies for a cookie exchange and everyone loved them. These will be added to my list to make every year!

This was my first time ever making Gingerbread. I didnt use McCormick spices, but that dosent matter. They turned out great. My family doesnt usually like Gingerbread but they loved these. They had the perfect about of spiciness and while they were being made had one of the most beautiful, classic holiday smells. The recipe does say it makes only 24 servings, but i ended up with 52 five-inch cookies! (I'm not complaining)
For the frosting I made a buttercream. To make it I used:
-one stick of butter(room temp.)
-1 and 1/2 cups powdered sugar
-half tsp. vanilla extract
I than whipped them together on medium speed for 3 minutes.

Over all these cookies were amazing and I will definitely make them again.
